result.execSummary:
The defendant Savannah C Fox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs for any reason.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by the Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Case 14CF785 and 14CM1274 were both dismissed and read into: 14CF787.

Nonworking hours with standard release conditions after the 90 day mark.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed by Defense.

Defendant Savannah C Fox in court, in custody, with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) concurrent to Ct. 2  Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail consecutive 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs for any reason.  Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
- 9 months jail Condition Time - 71 days credit -  commencing FORTHWITH with nonworking hours after the 90 day mark.   Non-working hours with standard release conditions.
 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) concurrent to Ct. 1  Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail consecutive 
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs for any reason.  Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Revoking Huber Bailee Privileges,   signed by Judge Donald J. Hassin, Jr. August 25, 2014.

Defendant Savannah C Fox in court, in custody, with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Peirce is prepared to plead on 14CF787, but not on 14CF785 or 14CM1274.  SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND MADE by Defense on 14CF785 and 14CM1274. Court notes request. Court will set trial dates on 14CF785 and 14CM1274. Court will trail along 14CF787.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Savannah C Fox in court, in custody, with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Defense requests a bail modification. State objects. Court denied the motion, but she may have huber bailee status and she has to report to WCS for any drugs tests. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.
